result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alex K. Revels

records.addlTxt: No contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless incidental as a result within a public forum.  No contact whatsoever with his daughter, S.R.

3:22 PM Defendant Alex K. Revels appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Leonie Dolch appeared by video for Alex K. Revels. Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties.  Advised of rights to an attorney.  DE does not qualify for PD representation.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  State recommends $5,000 cash bond.  Atty Dolch recommends a signature bond or less cash bond.  Atty Dolch requests no contact unless incidental contact.  $500.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with anyone under the age of 18 unless incidental as a result within a public forum.  No contact whatsoever with his daughter, S.R.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Return date scheduled for September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on September 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on September 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
